headline: Semiotic meaning
description: If intent to communicate is there, does it matter how the process started? This post blends visual sketchwork and recursive semiotics to examine how meaning unfolds, even when the origin is unstable or opaque. Two interconnected diagrams suggest a passage from safety to complexity, from containment to overflow.
timeFelt: late evening conceptual sketching, somewhere between reflection and play
whyItMatters: The origin of a signal—intent, accident, or emergence—may not change its reception. This post plays with the idea that meaning can drift yet still cohere, forming its own internal logic independent of beginning.
articleExcerpt: If intent to communicate is there does it matter how the process started?
sourceFragments: a visual suggestion that containment gives way to coded complexity

associatedMedia.description: Two abstract circular diagrams hand-drawn in a notebook, linked by a yellow line. Each contains colorful segments and cryptic labels, suggesting a transformation or migration of meaning. A basketball game plays on a screen in the background, hinting at play versus structure.
